proposal_location_options_T004.text: [{'url': 'https://photo-trips.com/where-to-propose-in-japan-best-proposal-spots/', 'content': 'Where To Propose In Japan - 15 Romantic Spots You Should Know Skip to content Sign In Home Tokyo Kyoto Osaka Mt Fuji Seoul Blog About Us Contact Sign In Sign In Home Tokyo Kyoto Osaka Mt Fuji Seoul Blog About Us Contact Sign In List a Property Japan Where To Propose In Japan 15 Romantic Spots You Should Know January 2, 2025 By Photo Trips If youre reading this, then we bet youre well on your way to planning the proposal of a lifetime! Were so excited for you to embark on this next chapter with your lifelong partner. If proposals are on your mind, Japan is definitely one of the best places to do so. Here well tell you everything you need to know if youre planning to craft a memorable proposal on your trip to Japan! Dont miss the end of the article, we recommend you great photographers in Japan to capture this special moment. Is Japan a good place to propose? The short answer is: Yes, absolutely! Japan is one of peoples top destinations for a reason. With its mix of modern wonders, traditional architecture, and natural beauty, Japan stands out as one of the best places to visit if you want to make a big impression. Thats what makes it such a perfect place for proposals! When proposing, its not only the location that you need to take note of but also the right moment. After all, you wouldnt want to time your proposal wrong! Whether your planned proposal is more of an intimate moment or a grand gesture, we have a wide selection of places in Japan to suit your needs. From classic spots that deserve to be called iconic in their own right, to hidden gems just waiting to be discovered, weve listed 15 gorgeous spots for a once-in-a-lifetime memorable proposal. Where to propose in Japan? The 15 Best Spots 1. Mt. Fuji Of course, we have to start with the iconic Mt. Fuji. It is part of Japans Three Holy Mountains along with Mount Haku and Mount Tate. But among these three, Mt. Fuji definitely stands out as one of the most iconic symbols of the country. Located about 100 KM (62 miles) from Tokyo, its perfect shape and glorious appearance have made it a pilgrimage site for centuries. To this day, Mt. Fuji stands out as one of the most picturesque places in the country. The best part? On clear days, its quite visible from Tokyo! If you dont want to travel outside of the capital, plenty of Tokyo spots offer beautiful views of the mountain, especially on the citys numerous observation decks. A proposal with Mt. Fuji in the background is as classy and timeless as can be. Who knows? Maybe proposing here will mean your future relationship will be as strong and stable as this great mountain! If you decided to propose in Mt Fuji, we highly recommend you to hire this photographer: Proposal Photographer Mount Fuji . His photos are outstanding as you can see below. For more tips, you can also read our full guide on how to propose in Mount Fuji ! 2. Wedded Rocks (Meoto Iwa) The name itself is already making us hear wedding bells. The Meoto Iwa site is located in Mie Prefecture in the Kansai Region, and it is truly a sight to behold. There is something so strangely beautiful and indeed, even sacred about two giant boulders at sea, connected together by a thick rope. This rope isnt any ordinary rope, either its shimenawa rope, believed to connect the spiritual and earthly realms together. These Wedded Rocks stand as a gorgeous spectacle and indeed one of the most memorable places you could begin your next chapter in life. The solemnity of the place paired with the stunning view of the rocky site will definitely make for an intimate yet powerful proposal. For that added magical touch, we recommend proposing at sunset! 3. Tokyo Tower Speaking of classics, we cant not mention Tokyo Tower. The countrys most famous and really, iconic skyscraper has borne witness to many proposals done within its premises and for good reason! The Tower offers an exhilarating view that will get you and your partners hearts pumping in no time, making for the perfect moment to pop that important question. At over 1,000 feet high, Tokyo Tower will offer you a beautiful panoramic view of the city that youd be really hard-pressed to get anywhere else. Theres nothing like gathering your courage to take a leap of faith (metaphorically, of course!) onto the next chapter of your life as you bask in this jaw-dropping view among the clouds. 4. Lake Mashu While we want to highlight those classic spots that draw dozens of proposals a year, we also want to give a shout out to the lesser-known hidden gems that would make for beautiful proposal spots as well. One of these is Lake Mashu! Located in the Akan Mashu National Park in Hokkaido, Lake Mashu is the perfect picturesque place to have your proposal. Make no mistake, Lake Mashu is no ordinary lake. In fact, its actually a crater lake formed over 7,000 years ago by a volcano! Known for being one of the clearest lakes in the world, Lake Mashu is unlike any other. This venue is especially perfect if your partner is a fan of astrology or stargazing because the night sky looks especially brilliant when reflected on the lakes surface. Sign up for one of Lake Mashus stargazing tours and find a quiet little nook around the area to ask the question! 5. Himeji Castle What better way to make your future life partner feel like royalty than proposing at Himeji Castle? Make your fairytale dreams come true by visiting this incredible historic site located in the Hyogo Prefecture. Just picture this pure white castle, a living example of the greatness of Japanese traditional architecture, located on top of a beautiful hill. To make the scene even more majestic, we suggest going during Spring so you can see the beautiful cherry blossom trees in full bloom surrounding the castle! You May Also Like : Cherry Blossom Forecast Dates in Japan Nicknamed the White Egret Castle or the White Heron Castle due to its stunning white exterior and resemblance to a majestic bird about to take flight, Himeji Castle dates back hundreds upon hundreds of years all the way to 1333. Registered as one of Japans first UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Himeji Castle should definitely be on your list. The photos dont do this glorious structure justice. And who knows? Maybe proposing here will mean your marriage will be as long-lasting as this castle! 6. The Seven Waterfalls of Kawazu If your significant other loves the great outdoors, then we definitely recommend checking out the seven waterfalls of Kawazu! Located in the Izu Peninsula, these seven glorious waterfalls raining down from the mountains vary spectacularly in height. From a whopping 30 meters (98 feet) to a petite 2-meter (6.5 feet) waterfall, these natural beauties are truly a sight to see. The seven waterfalls of Kawazu have inspired many works of literature, including the 1926 novel The Izu Dancer by Japans Nobel Prize Winner Kawabata Yasunari. Thats why youll see plenty of gorgeous statues in the area inspired by the text. Even better, this area is also known for having beautiful onsens (natural hot spring baths) that would just be the perfect place to relax in as you and your partner begin your next chapter in life together. 7. Kamogawa Riverside If your partner loves nature but wants something a little more on the quiet and understated side, then we recommend checking out the Kamogawa Riverside. Located in Kyoto, Kamogawa Riverside is basically one huge park where locals and tourists alike love to relax and spend time. The whole place becomes even lovelier at dusk when the traditional houses all light up, adding to the warm and romantic atmosphere that makes it perfect for low-key proposals. Its a quiet and peaceful area that has its own understated charm, making it a wonderful pick to ask the most important question of your life! 8. Chidorigafuchi Canal Speaking of, there really is just something so romantic about different bodies of water, huh? And of course, Japan has plenty of these kinds of places for you to choose from.
